Quickstride looks around at the lights and gives a tiny grunt.

"My idea co=
uldn't come soon enough.  Slight fluxuation in energy flow..  Means we got =
power but not a stable supply...  Okay, that can be remedied.  Now, let's s=
ee...  I hope Wheeljack's lab is still useable, I don't think Tucson would =
allow me in his.."

He punches the code to access Wheeljacks' old lab, and =
not surprisingly enough, it was a bit of a mess.

"Ohh boy.  Wow, I'm sure =
I'll definitely find what I need in here.  But first, to the drawing board.=
.  Yeah, if I - can find it."  

He couldn't help but trip over things but =
being careful not to break any of the materials and tools inside. Being rig=
ht next to Tucson's work lab, Straight Shot could hear him stumbling about =
inside. She couldn't help but chuckle, but she also knew that he could use =
a hand.  Yet, she did not want to leave Elita alone.  She brings the tiny c=
ub with her, and bravely goes where no bot had dared before.  Inside Wheelj=
acks' laboratory.

"Woah, what - a mess.  Quickstride, are you sure you rea=
lly wanna work in here?"

He looks to her, as something bonks off his head.=


"Ow.  Yeah, I'm sure, I don't think it would be wise for us ta use Tucson=
's lab, I don't think he'd want anything touched."

Straight Shot smiles.

=
"Hey, he's the one who suggested making some of those changes.  I'm sure he=
 wouldn't mind you using his lab.  Besides, it's safer and everything you n=
eed is readilly available. Just make sure everything goes back where you fi=
nd it."

Quickstride nodds.

"On second thought, yeah, maybe it is better i=
f I work in his lab. Okay, let's do it."

Straight Shot now works with Quic=
kstride in Tucson's laboratory, while still holding Elita.  She shows the c=
ub where Research and Development happens, as Quickstride goes to work on d=
rawing something up on the drawing board.

" See, he's just starting with t=
he development stage, and after that, once he draws up a few rough composit=
ions, he'll show them to Rodimus and the others, and the one Rodimus thinks=
 will work best, he'll develop further, and refine this into a blue print. =
 From there, blue prints turn into prototypes, and then prototypes are test=
ed, and if they work, then, more of the product is manufactured based on te=
st results."

Quickstride smiles while working.

"That's right, hopefully w=
e'll come up with something... But I'm a little lost as ta how ta start thi=
s..  We gotta make it high enough but not conspicuous... We wouldn't want i=
t to be shot down by our enemy.."

Straight Shot ponders.

"Yeah, that coul=
d be a problem..  I remember physics..  We'd have to construct something th=
at functions yet fits to form..  There's a lot of high peaks around here an=
d maybe we could take a look at which one would actually fit the device bes=
t.."

Quickstride nodds.

"True.  We gotta see the area before we can actua=
lly drum up something.  I know, why don't I try to get some mini probes out=
 there and see what they can photograph for us?  That way, we'll know how t=
o construct the alternate turbine and then take it from there."

Straight S=
hot nodds.

"Sounds like a plan."

Quickstride heads to Rodimus but is care=
ful not to be too noisy.

"Sir, Straight Shot and I are working in Tucson's=
 lab now, and before we can start, we need to get a geographical layout of =
the surrounding parameter.  It appears we need a high peak of some sort to =
carry the weight of the wind mill structure.  It would hide the device from=
 harm, and basically keep the environment the same without harming it. I'm =
going to send some mini probes out there to photograph the area.  Once I ge=
t those back, I'll be able to draw up something."
